conclusion: The toy car A enters the scene from the lower-right with moderate speed and a shallow left-ward trajectory.
Because its path is aimed almost exactly at the small orange stack that sits in front of the taller blue tower, the first contact it makes is with the orange stack.
The impact topples the orange blocks forward and slightly left, but the car still has enough momentum to glance off the side of the tall blue tower.
This secondary contact deflects the front of the car to the left.
After the deflection, the carâ€™s remaining speed is no longer sufficient to carry it to the more distant green or red stacks.
Instead, it slows quickly while skidding leftward and comes to rest in the open area just in front of the green (two-block) stack.
Glancing second collision: lower edge of blue tower (blue blocks remain standing).
No contact with the red, green, or yellow blocks.
Car A stops on the cloth, left of the original orange/blue position, just short of the green stack.
